such as light waves, sound waves, radio waves, and the nervous system. The devices that
convert the message into symbols or technically speaking, transform the message
into a signal, are called tools. Radio receivers
and transmitters are such tools; they convert spoken words into sound waves: the sound waves then act as
a channel. Television is a tool; with the help of its receivers and transmitters, it transforms images and sounds into
light and sound waves: which then act as the channel. A code is a system of meanings
that is accepted and shared by members of the same culture at a specific time
and place. Encoding is the process of turning feelings, thoughts, designs, or imaginations into
a communication or message. This encoding can be verbal as well as non-verbal.
Decoding is the process of attributing meaning to the feelings, thoughts, designs, or
